meanings.definition: The ability to perceive sounds or words from a distance without the use of physical ears.
meanings.sent1: Her clairaudience allowed her to hear whispers from across the room.
meanings.sent2: Some people claim to possess clairaudience and hear voices from the spirit world.
meanings.sent3: During the test, his clairaudience kicked in, and he heard the answers in his head.
meanings.sent4: Her clairaudience was like having a secret radio tuned to faraway conversations.
meanings.sent5: The clairaudience of the main character in the story made her a valuable spy.

meanings.definition: The psychic ability to hear voices or sounds that are not audible to the normal ear.
meanings.sent1: The clairaudience of the psychic medium allowed her to communicate with the deceased.
meanings.sent2: People with clairaudience may hear messages from the spiritual realm.
meanings.sent3: The clairaudience of the fortune teller made for some interesting predictions.
meanings.sent4: His clairaudience was so strong, he could hear the thoughts of those around him.
meanings.sent5: The clairaudience of the old man was both a gift and a burden.
